com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.gaian

Class GaianOpinionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.watson.dsm.services.gaian.GaianOpinionManager

  • public class GaianOpinionManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a distributed rule-based system to collaborate with neighbors to build a local opinion about each neighbor. Each distributed gaian node makes observations about its neighbors and submits them locally here. The rule system processes these submissions and may share them or other data with the neighboring nodes. The local node then, can ask this instance for a list of neighbors and associated opinions about them. This information can then be used to make decisions about making use of neighbors for routing, for example.

    After creation, the instance must be started via the start() method and later stopped with the stop() method. Operations to store observations and retrieve opinions are only valid in between calls to start() and stop().

    Author:
    dawood

    • Constructor Detail

      • GaianOpinionManager

        public GaianOpinionManager(java.lang.String nodeID,
                   java.lang.String rulesFile,
                   INeighborProvider gdbInfo)
                    throws java.io.IOException,
                           DSMException
        Create a monitor for use by a single gaian node and associate the given node id with it. Observations from this node and shared by others will be processed through the given rules file, which must provide the following tables:
        1. input my_observations(char[128] node, double opinion); // Used to send observations into the rule engine
        2. persistent my_opinions(char[128] node, double opinion); // Use to store my opinions by the rule engine.
        If these are not provided, an exception will be called when this instance started with start().
        Parameters:
        nodeID - the id to be associated with this engine and which we expect other nodes will use when they call setObservation(String, double) to register their observation about this node.
        If the GOM_DEMO_MODE_ENV_VAR is set, then reates the opinion manager to use a global DSM routing table so that each node knows about all the others, which then enables us to provide access to ALL opinion scores across the whole network. This ONLY desirable when running the demonstration which would like to show all opinion scores.
        rulesFile - contains the high-level rules file (.dsmr file) that processes local and remote observations to create our local opinions and place them in the my_opinions table defined above.
        gdbInfo - implementation to allow the engine to get node and ip address information about neighbors.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        DSMException

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws DSMException
        Start the monitor and validate the rules file to be sure it has the required tables and table schema.
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws DSMException
        Throws:
        DSMException

      • getOpinions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> getOpinions()
        Get the opinions about all neighbor nodes for which we have an opinion. The returned map, maps node names, as passed into setObservation(String, double), to Double values, between -1 and 1 representing our opinion of them, with -1 being the most negative and 1 being the most positive.
        Returns:
        null if an error occurred getting the opinions.

      • setObservation

        public void setObservation(java.lang.String nodeID,
                  double observationOpinion)
        Set our local observation-based opinion of the node having the given node id. Multiple calls with the same node id are expected. The node ids used here and by peer gaian nodes will later be returned by getOpinions().

        Note that opinions can also be sent using ObservationSimulator, in which case, this method is not called and the tuples go directly to the engine.

        Parameters:
        nodeID - id of the node for which the observation-based opinion applies. This is a string defined by the application.
        observationOpinion - a number in the range -1..1 representing the score with 1 being the most positive opinion and -1 the most negative opinion.

      • createObservation

        public static ITupleSet createObservation(java.lang.String sendingInstanceID,

                          double score)
